result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony T Wilks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for work and treatment.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens.  No positive results. No illegal drugs. Maintain absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony T Wilks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: One of three cell phones exhibit #5, a Large black cell phone with otter box case removed from inventory and returned to defendant per 02/26/15 order of Judge Stark. jew

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter from Assistant City Attorney Kurt Behling dated February 21, 2015, received and filed.

Petitioner Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe via telephone.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No representative appears for the City of Milwaukee.
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner. For the reason placed on the record the State does not wish to participate in the proceedings. Petitioner sworn and examined by the Court. Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.
Return of property hearing on February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case is scheduled for Return of Property Hearing on 2-20-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17 will be down. Case is rescheduled for Return of Property Hearing on 2-26-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Parties notified.
Return of property hearing on February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
MPD Inventory #14008679.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D249.  jew

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 
days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.
Guilty to the lesser included offense of POSSESSION OF COCAINE.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: alp  

  At the hour of 9:58 a.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty to the lesser included offense of POSSESSION OF COCAINE, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks not in court.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bailffs Cleveland and D'Addario sworn at 8:34 a.m.  At 8:45 Bailiff Laranth relieved Bailiff D'Addario and remains sworn.  Jury deliberating.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     
Jury in box.  Remaining sworn for the State:   Detective Angela Juarez, MPD.  


State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  

Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Meeting held in chambers regarding jury instructions.
Jury in box.  

Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  

Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  

Jury retired at the hour of 4:09 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Laranth and Stauss, who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

Due to the late hour, case adjourned to 8-9-14, 8:45 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box.

 Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Christopher Conway, MPD, Exhibit #8 (Stipulation) read in open court to the jury, Officer Matthew Gadzalinski, MPD, Detective Angela Juarez, MPD.    

Exhibits received as documented on official exhibit list..  Case passed for the lunch hour.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Later same day, same appearances.  Stipulation received by the court.  Jury in box.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.

Court instructed jury.  

Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded. 

Sworn for the state:  Officer Christopher Navarrette, MPD.  Exhibits received as reflected on official exhibit list.    Due to the late hour, case adjourned to 7-8-14, 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:30 a.m.  Case passed for the lunch hour.
Final pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7-7-14, 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Cocaine (<= 5G), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(1m)(cm)1r, 939.50(3)(f), a Class F Felony.   Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Filed by the State:  Witness List, Motion in Limine, Requested Jury Instructions.  alp
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 26 scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Anthony T Wilks in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Anthony T Wilks in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
